content.question:
NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION.

Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit.

Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point.

Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math> is a real number.

Let <math alttext="g"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function defined by <math alttext="g of x, equals, the square root of 6 x, end root"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msqrt><mrow><mn>6</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>. Let <math alttext="R"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the region in the first quadrant bounded above by the graph of <math alttext="g"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="0 less than or equal to x, less than or equal to 4"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(a)   Find the area of <math alttext="R"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

frqParts.text:
NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION.

Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit.

Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point.

Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math> is a real number.

Let <math alttext="g"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function defined by <math alttext="g of x, equals, the square root of 6 x, end root"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msqrt><mrow><mn>6</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>. Let <math alttext="R"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the region in the first quadrant bounded above by the graph of <math alttext="g"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="0 less than or equal to x, less than or equal to 4"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(a)   Find the area of <math alttext="R"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(b)   The region <math alttext="R"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is the base of a solid. For this solid, each cross section perpendicular to the <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis is a semicircle whose diameter lies in <math alttext="R"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. Find the volume of the solid.

(c)   Let <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be an antiderivative of <math alttext="g"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. Find the length of the graph of <math alttext="f"><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></math> from <math alttext="x equals 0"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="x equals 4"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

topic.text: 8.4: Finding the Area Between Curves Expressed as Functions of x

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
